title: Business & Finance
text:
The number of workers seeking and receiving unemployment benefits through state and federal programs has reached pandemic lows ahead of this summer, when 22 states plan to end a $300 federal benefit early.

---

U.S. stocks snapped a three-day losing streak, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq gaining 1.1%, 0.6% and 1.8%, respectively.

The prices of bitcoin, ether and other cryptocurrencies found some respite, regaining some ground after a broad selloff.

---

Morgan Stanley set up a four-way race to one day succeed CEO Gorman, elevating a number of senior executives into new roles.

---

Apollo co-founder Josh Harris will step down from day-to-day responsibilities at the company early next year, the firm said.

---

Ford struck a deal with South Korean firm SK Innovation to form a joint venture to build electric-car batteries in the U.S.

---

Shares of Oatly, the Swedish oat-milk maker, jumped 19% in their trading debut on the Nasdaq .

---

JPMorgan is having a second crack at employee healthcare just months after ending its Haven health venture with Amazon and Berkshire.
